intro: Eyrythalia glacialis, commonly known as the glacier erythra. This rare alpine plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically found in mountainous regions with cold climates. The plant has a compact growth form, with hairy leaves that help insulate it against freezing temperatures. Its botanical features are adapted to survive in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and harsh weather conditions.
